member.name: IShellIcon.GetIconOf
member.summary: Gets an icon for an object inside a specific folder.
member.param: The address of the structure that specifies the relative location of the folder.

param.name: flags
param.para: Flags specifying how the icon is to display. This parameter can be zero or one of the following values.
The icon is to be displayed in a Shell folder.

The icon should be in the open state if both open-state and closed-state images are available. If this flag is not specified, the icon should be in the closed state. This flag is typically used for folder objects.

param.name: pIconIndex
param.para: The address of the index of the icon in the system image list. The following standard image list indexes can be returned.
Application (file name extension must be .exe, .com, or .bat)

member.returns: Returns S_OK if lpIconIndex contains the correct system image list index, or S_FALSE if an icon can't be obtained for this object.

member.name: IShellIcon
member.summary: Exposes a method that obtains an icon index for an object.
